segment.source: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.
segment.target: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.

segment.source: Use input scope to change the touch keyboard
segment.target: Use input scope to change the touch keyboard

segment.source: Use input scope to change the touch keyboard
segment.target: Use input scope to change the touch keyboard

segment.source: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.
segment.target: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: InputScope
segment.target: InputScope

segment.source: InputScopeNameValue
segment.target: InputScopeNameValue

segment.source: The touch keyboard can be used for text entry when your app runs on a device with a touch screen.
segment.target: The touch keyboard can be used for text entry when your app runs on a device with a touch screen.

segment.source: The touch keyboard is invoked when the user taps on an editable input field, such as a TextBox or RichEditBox.
segment.target: The touch keyboard is invoked when the user taps on an editable input field, such as a TextBox or RichEditBox.

segment.source: You can make it much faster and easier for users to enter data in your app by setting the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data you expect the user to enter.
segment.target: You can make it much faster and easier for users to enter data in your app by setting the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data you expect the user to enter.

segment.source: The input scope provides a hint to the system about the type of text input expected by the control so the system can provide a specialized touch keyboard layout for the input type.
segment.target: The input scope provides a hint to the system about the type of text input expected by the control so the system can provide a specialized touch keyboard layout for the input type.

segment.source: For example, if a text box is used only to enter a 4-digit PIN, set the InputScope property to Number.
segment.target: For example, if a text box is used only to enter a 4-digit PIN, set the InputScope property to Number.

segment.source: This tells the system to show the number keypad layout, which makes it easier for the user to enter the PIN.
segment.target: This tells the system to show the number keypad layout, which makes it easier for the user to enter the PIN.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This info applies only to the SIP.
segment.target: This info applies only to the SIP.

segment.source: It does not apply to hardware keyboards or the On-Screen Keyboard available in the Windows Ease of Access options.
segment.target: It does not apply to hardware keyboards or the On-Screen Keyboard available in the Windows Ease of Access options.

segment.source: The input scope does not cause any input validation to be performed, and does not prevent the user from providing any input through a hardware keyboard or other input device.
segment.target: The input scope does not cause any input validation to be performed, and does not prevent the user from providing any input through a hardware keyboard or other input device.

segment.source: You are still responsible for validating the input in your code as needed.
segment.target: You are still responsible for validating the input in your code as needed.

segment.source: Changing the input scope of a text control
segment.target: Changing the input scope of a text control

segment.source: The input scopes that are available to your app are members of the InputScopeNameValue enumeration.
segment.target: The input scopes that are available to your app are members of the InputScopeNameValue enumeration.

segment.source: You can set the InputScope property of a TextBox or RichEditBox to one of these values.
segment.target: You can set the InputScope property of a TextBox or RichEditBox to one of these values.

segment.source: Important The InputScope property on PasswordBox supports only the Password and NumericPin values.
segment.target: Important The InputScope property on PasswordBox supports only the Password and NumericPin values.

segment.source: Any other value is ignored.
segment.target: Any other value is ignored.

segment.source: Here, you change the input scope of several text boxes to match the expected data for each text box.
segment.target: Here, you change the input scope of several text boxes to match the expected data for each text box.

segment.source: To change the input scope in XAML
segment.target: To change the input scope in XAML

segment.source: In the XAML file for your page, locate the tag for the text control that you want to change.
segment.target: In the XAML file for your page, locate the tag for the text control that you want to change.

segment.source: Add the InputScope attribute to the tag and specify the InputScopeNameValue value that matches the expected input.
segment.target: Add the InputScope attribute to the tag and specify the InputScopeNameValue value that matches the expected input.

segment.source: Here are some text boxes that might appear on a common customer-contact form.
segment.target: Here are some text boxes that might appear on a common customer-contact form.

segment.source: With the InputScope set, a touch keyboard with a suitable layout for the data shows for each text box.
segment.target: With the InputScope set, a touch keyboard with a suitable layout for the data shows for each text box.

segment.source: To change the input scope in code
segment.target: To change the input scope in code

segment.source: In the XAML file for your page, locate the tag for the text control that you want to change.
segment.target: In the XAML file for your page, locate the tag for the text control that you want to change.

segment.source: If it's not set, set the x:Name attribute so you can reference the control in your code.
segment.target: If it's not set, set the x:Name attribute so you can reference the control in your code.

segment.source: Instantiate a new InputScope object.
segment.target: Instantiate a new InputScope object.

segment.source: Instantiate a new InputScopeName object.
segment.target: Instantiate a new InputScopeName object.

segment.source: Set the NameValue property of the InputScopeName object to a value of the InputScopeNameValue enumeration.
segment.target: Set the NameValue property of the InputScopeName object to a value of the InputScopeNameValue enumeration.

segment.source: Add the InputScopeName object to the Names collection of the InputScope object.
segment.target: Add the InputScopeName object to the Names collection of the InputScope object.

segment.source: Set the InputScope object as the value of the text control's InputScope property.
segment.target: Set the InputScope object as the value of the text control's InputScope property.

segment.source: Here's the code all together.
segment.target: Here's the code all together.

segment.source: The same steps can be condensed into this shorthand code.
segment.target: The same steps can be condensed into this shorthand code.

segment.source: Text prediction, spell checking, and auto-correction
segment.target: Text prediction, spell checking, and auto-correction

segment.source: The TextBox and RichEditBox controls have several properties that influence the behavior of the SIP.
segment.target: The TextBox and RichEditBox controls have several properties that influence the behavior of the SIP.

segment.source: To provide the best experience for your users, it's important to understand how these properties affect text input using touch.
segment.target: To provide the best experience for your users, it's important to understand how these properties affect text input using touch.

segment.source: IsSpellCheckEnabled —When spell check is enabled for a text control, the control interacts with the system's spell-check engine to mark words that are not recognized.
segment.target: IsSpellCheckEnabled —When spell check is enabled for a text control, the control interacts with the system's spell-check engine to mark words that are not recognized.

segment.source: You can tap a word to see a list of suggested corrections.
segment.target: You can tap a word to see a list of suggested corrections.

segment.source: Spell checking is enabled by default.
segment.target: Spell checking is enabled by default.

segment.source: For the Default input scope, this property also enables automatic capitalization of the first word in a sentence and auto-correction of words as you type.
segment.target: For the Default input scope, this property also enables automatic capitalization of the first word in a sentence and auto-correction of words as you type.

segment.source: These auto-correction features might be disabled in other input scopes.
segment.target: These auto-correction features might be disabled in other input scopes.

segment.source: For more info, see the tables later in this topic.
segment.target: For more info, see the tables later in this topic.

segment.source: IsTextPredictionEnabled —When text prediction is enabled for a text control, the system shows a list of words that you might be beginning to type.
segment.target: IsTextPredictionEnabled —When text prediction is enabled for a text control, the system shows a list of words that you might be beginning to type.

segment.source: You can select from the list so you don't have to type the whole word.
segment.target: You can select from the list so you don't have to type the whole word.

segment.source: Text prediction is enabled by default.
segment.target: Text prediction is enabled by default.

segment.source: Text prediction might be disabled if the input scope is other than Default, even if the IsTextPredictionEnabled property is true.
segment.target: Text prediction might be disabled if the input scope is other than Default, even if the IsTextPredictionEnabled property is true.

segment.source: For more info, see the tables later in this topic.
segment.target: For more info, see the tables later in this topic.

segment.source: Note On the Mobile device family, text predictions and spelling corrections are shown in the SIP in the area above the keyboard.
segment.target: Note On the Mobile device family, text predictions and spelling corrections are shown in the SIP in the area above the keyboard.

segment.source: If IsTextPredictionEnabled is set to false, this part of the SIP is hidden and auto-correction is disabled, even if IsSpellCheckEnabled is true.
segment.target: If IsTextPredictionEnabled is set to false, this part of the SIP is hidden and auto-correction is disabled, even if IsSpellCheckEnabled is true.

segment.source: PreventKeyboardDisplayOnProgrammaticFocus —When this property is true, it prevents the system from showing the SIP when focus is programmatically set on a text control.
segment.target: PreventKeyboardDisplayOnProgrammaticFocus —When this property is true, it prevents the system from showing the SIP when focus is programmatically set on a text control.

segment.source: Instead, the keyboard is shown only when the user interacts with the control.
segment.target: Instead, the keyboard is shown only when the user interacts with the control.

segment.source: Touch keyboard index for Windows and Windows Phone
segment.target: Touch keyboard index for Windows and Windows Phone

segment.source: These tables show the Soft Input Panel (SIP) layouts on desktop and mobile devices for common input scope values.
segment.target: These tables show the Soft Input Panel (SIP) layouts on desktop and mobile devices for common input scope values.

segment.source: The effect of the input scope on the features enabled by the IsSpellCheckEnabled and IsTextPredictionEnabled properties is listed for each input scope.
segment.target: The effect of the input scope on the features enabled by the IsSpellCheckEnabled and IsTextPredictionEnabled properties is listed for each input scope.

segment.source: This is not a comprehensive list of available input scopes.
segment.target: This is not a comprehensive list of available input scopes.

segment.source: Note The smaller size of the SIP on mobile devices makes it particularly important for mobile apps that you set the correct input scope.
segment.target: Note The smaller size of the SIP on mobile devices makes it particularly important for mobile apps that you set the correct input scope.

segment.source: As we show here, Windows Phone provides a greater variety of specialized keyboard layouts.
segment.target: As we show here, Windows Phone provides a greater variety of specialized keyboard layouts.

segment.source: A text field that doesn't need to have its input scope set in a Windows Store app might benefit from having it set in a Windows Phone Store app.
segment.target: A text field that doesn't need to have its input scope set in a Windows Store app might benefit from having it set in a Windows Phone Store app.

segment.source: Tip You can toggle most touch keyboards between an alphabetic layout and a numbers-and-symbols layout.
segment.target: Tip You can toggle most touch keyboards between an alphabetic layout and a numbers-and-symbols layout.

segment.source: On Windows, toggle the &123 key.
segment.target: On Windows, toggle the &123 key.

segment.source: On Windows Phone, press the &123 key to change to the numbers-and-symbols layout, and press the abcd key to change to the alphabetic layout.
segment.target: On Windows Phone, press the &123 key to change to the numbers-and-symbols layout, and press the abcd key to change to the alphabetic layout.
